channel.title: [Project Insanity] Timers & Experience Rates [Project Insanity]
channel.description:
Hey guys,
I need help understanding how the Timers & Experience Rates work in Project Insanity. I know how a timer works, but I'm confused because;
[b]Timers[/b] My cycle time (tick) is set to 600, but i don't know say I want to set a timer does 1000 mean 1 second or 600 mean 1 second i'm really confused.
[b]Experience Rates[/b] In Project Insanity you have Melee exp rate, Ranging exp rate and Ragic exp rate. They're all set to 300, I'm confused does this mean for each 1 you hit that means 300 xp, or does it mean what you hit * 300? Example: I hit a 10, so 10 * 300 = 3000.
Thanks a lot, I'd really like an answer for these to answers.

item.title: [Project Insanity] Timers & Experience Rates [Project Insanity]
item.dc:creator: @ohokay ohokay
item.description:
@ohokay wrote:

[quote=“Skyro, post:4, topic:460013”][quote author=Valazar link=topic=562923.msg4103840#msg4103840 date=1347774772]
600 milliseconds = 60 seconds.

Its hit * rate so, 300 x 10 = 3,000 exp.
[/quote]
Can I get someone to please check that and make sure it’s correct?[/quote]

It’s in the source somewhere, you can look for it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Skyro wrote:

Hey guys,

I need help understanding how the Timers & Experience Rates work in Project Insanity. I know how a timer works, but I’m confused because;

Timers
